title: Boxer Deepak Puts Up A Giant Effort To Win Silver At Military Games In China
text:
Indian boxer Deepak put up a spirited effort in the summit clash at the Military Games, but had to unfortunately settle for a silver medal.

PTI

After impressing throughout the tournament and storming in to the final, the young Indian boxing prodigy Deepak fell short as he was defeated 0-5 by gold medallist Zhussupov Temirtas of Kazakhstan in the final.

Participating in the men’s light fly weight (46-49kg) category, Deepak was brave in his approach as he looked to attack from the get go, but his opponent Temirtas was up for the challenge as he used great maneuvers to dominate the match.

PTI

There were a few decision that could have gone the Indian's way, but it didn't happen as Deepak had to settle for a silver medal.

Balaji then added to India's tally by outclassing Uzbekistan's Fomin Sergey 6-2, 6-3 in the men's singles bronze medal contest that lasted one hour 19 minutes. It was India's second medal in boxing on the day.





(With Inputs From PTI)
